snippet: Even before Donald J. Trump began his presidential campaign by demonizing Mexican immigrants, young people with ties to the country were becoming politically active and urging others to do the same.
abstract: Side Street column; Janet Perez of immigration advocacy group Masa has been walking streets of Bronx inviting those who are worried about rumors of immigration raids to attend community meetings to dispel misinformation; group's work is signal of how Mexican community has grown and matured politically, in many ways thanks to experiences of previous generations of immigrants.
lead_paragraph: Even before Donald J. Trump began his presidential campaign by demonizing Mexican immigrants, young people with ties to the country were becoming politically active and urging others to do the same.

headline.print_headline: Young, Mexican and Ready to Speak Out
headline.main: Young, Mexican and Ready to Raise Their Political Voices
